alert.note: Alert for Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:19PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Madison and central Beaverhead Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 419 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles north of Lima, or 20 miles south of Dillon, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Madison and central Beaverhead Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southwestern Montana.
